page.title: 14FARMING,SHEEP
page.content: The hill flocks winter there and receive a minimum of supplementary feeding except in particularly severe weather.However the ewe lambs and shearlings are sent to lowland past- ures in West Wales for their first two winters in order to provide them with better grazing. This modern form of transhumance is known as "tacking". Formerly the flocks were driven to the Cardiganshire lowlands, the journey requiring about one week. Later the sheep were moved by train. Today the sheep are transported by road. Lambing is late on the hills and the Cnewr hill flocks are lambing between mid-April and mid-May. On the lower land lambing comes about a month earlier.
